intro: Lomagramma praestantissima, commonly known as the slender rockmoss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, mat-forming plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on rocky surfaces or in crevices. The plant has a distinctive morphology with a leafy thallus that is often covered in a layer of fine, filamentous structures. Its reproductive structures, known as sporophytes, are borne on short stalks and produce spores for propagation. Lomagramma praestantissima is an indicator species for calcareous soils and is often used in ecological studies to assess habitat conditions.
